item.title: Introduction to Bayesian Inference using Stan with R (cmdstanr)
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: An introduction to Bayesian inference starting from the fundamentals. Examples are illustrated in R using the Stan language for Bayesian inference. The cmdstandr package is used to call Stan from R.

item.title: What is Gradient Descent? (Part I)
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: Exploring gradient descent using R and a minimal amount of mathematics

item.title: Statistical simulation of robust estimators with tidyverse tools
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: Tidyverse tools provide a powerful way to do statistical simulations. We demonstrate this approach by evaluating the properties of the mean and median as estimators of center for two distributions.

item.title: Using gganimate with ggmap
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: Combining gganimate with ggmap can be used to create animations of geographic data. I give a few examples using data from Nashville Open Data.

item.title: Repeated testing inflates type I error
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: Type I error is increased when you test your hypothesis multiple times during the data collection process. Simulations can provide a clear picture of this process.
